item.title: Brattleboro Company Takes Steps to Better Protect Public Health under EPA Settlement
item.description: BOSTON - A Brattleboro, Vt., company that manufactures coatings will design and install a system that captures and controls solvent vapors at its plant, ensuring that workers are protected from solvent emissions and that the environment is protected from a possible release of sol
item.dc:creator: Region 01

item.title: Maine Blueberry Processor Takes Steps to Better Protect Public Health under EPA Settlement
item.description: BOSTON - The owner of a blueberry processing facility in Hancock, Maine has come into compliance with federal requirements designed to protect the public and first responders from exposure to hazardous chemicals, under the terms of a recent settlement with EPA.
item.dc:creator: Region 01

item.title: Ashford Conn. Gets Funds for New Cleaner School Bus
item.description: BOSTON - The Town of Ashford, Conn. will receive $20,000 from the US Environmental Protection Agency to help pay for a new school bus that emits less pollution than its older bus. The new bus will help reduce pollution linked to health problems such as asthma and lung damage.
item.dc:creator: Region 01

item.title: Two Maine School Bus Fleets Get Funds for New Buses
item.description: BOSTON - Two school districts in Maine, in Kennebunk and in Sullivan, were chosen to receive a total of $200,000 from the US Environmental Protection Agency to help pay for new school buses.
item.dc:creator: Region 01

item.title: EPA Launches Technology Challenge for an Advanced Septic System Nitrogen Sensor
item.description: BOSTON - Today, the U.S. EPA and its partners launched a technology challenge for an Advanced Septic System Nitrogen Sensor. The total award pool for this phase is $55,000.
item.dc:creator: Region 01

item.title: Settlement Helps Protect Public Health in South Windsor, Conn.
item.description: BOSTON - Area residents and first responders in South Windsor, Conn.
item.dc:creator: Region 01

item.title: EPA Analysis Shows Decreased Toxic Chemical Releases in Connecticut in 2015
item.description: BOSTON - EPA's most recent Toxic Release Inventory (TRI) data is now available for the reporting year of 2015. In Connecticut, the reporting data show that overall releases of pollutants to the environment decreased since the previous reporting year (2014).
item.dc:creator: Region 01

item.description: BOSTON - EPA's most recent Toxic Release Inventory (TRI) data is now available for the reporting year of 2015. In Maine, the reporting data show that overall releases of pollutants to the environment decreased since the previous reporting year (2014).

item.title: EPA Analysis Shows Increased Toxic Chemical Releases in Vermont in 2015
item.description: BOSTON - EPA's most recent Toxic Release Inventory (TRI) data is now available for the reporting year of 2015. In Vermont, the reporting data show that overall releases of pollutants to the environment increased since the previous reporting year (2014).
